title: House Affordability Calculator | How much house can I afford?

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Mortgage payment (principal and interest), with monthly rate r and n payments: $$ M = \begin{cases} \dfrac{r \cdot L}{1 - (1 + r)^{-n}}, & r > 0 \\ \dfrac{L}{n}, & r = 0 \end{cases} $$ Total monthly housing cost: $$ H = M + \frac{\tau \cdot P}{12} + \frac{I_{annual}}{12} + HOA + PMI $$ DTI constraints: $$ H \le \min\!\left( \alpha \cdot \frac{Y}{12},\ \beta \cdot \frac{Y}{12} - D \right) $$ where L is loan amount, P is purchase price, Y is annual gross income, D is other monthly debt, τ is property tax rate (annual, as a decimal), Iannual is annual insurance, α is the front-end DTI limit, and β is the back-end DTI limit. The calculator numerically solves for the highest P that satisfies the constraint.
